intro: Batrachium floribundum, commonly known as the showy batrachium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, and it produces capsules as its fruit, containing numerous seeds.
